title-group.article-title: RECOVERING ZEROS OF POLYNOMIALS MODULO A PRIME

abstract.p: Let p be a prime and ùîΩp the finite field with p elements. We show how, when given an irreducible bivariate polynomial F ‚àà ùîΩp [X, Y] and an approximation to a zero, one can recover the root efficiently, if the approximation is good enough. The strategy can be generalized to polynomials in the variables X‚ÇÅ,...,Xm over the field ùîΩp. These results have been motivated by the predictability problem for nonlinear pseudorandom number generators and other potential applications to cryptography.
